xyz.fsgek.common.convert.handlers

Class ReuseConvertHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • xyz.fsgek.common.convert.handlers.ReuseConvertHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GekConverter.Handler

    public class ReuseConvertHandler
extends java.lang.Object
implements GekConverter.Handler
    Convert handler implementation which is used to check type compatibility and reusability, it follows in order:
    • If source object is null, return null;
    • If target type and source type are equal:
      • If GekConverter.Options#reusePolicy() is not GekConverter.Options#NO_REUSE, return source object, else return null;
    • If target type is assignable from source type by GekReflect.isAssignableFrom(Type, Type):
      • If GekConverter.Options#reusePolicy() is GekConverter.Options#REUSE_ASSIGNABLE, return source object, else return null;
    • If target type is TypeVariable, return GekFlag.BREAK;
    • If source type is WildcardType:
      • If source type has an upper bound (? extends), return: 
                             //sourceUpper is upper bound of source type
                     converter.convertObject(source, sourceUpper, targetType, options);
      • If source type has a lower bound (? super), return: 
                             converter.convertObject(source, Object.class, targetType, options);
    • If target type is WildcardType:
      • If target type has an upper bound (? extends), return: 
                             //targetUpper is upper bound of target type
                     converter.convert(source, sourceType, targetUpper, options);
      • If target type has a lower bound (? super), return: 
                             //targetLower is lower bound of target type
                     converter.convert(source, sourceType, targetLower, options.replaceReusePolicy(Options.REUSE_EQUAL));
    • Else return null;
    This handler is system default prefix handler.

    • Method Detail

      • convert

        @Nullable
public @Nullable java.lang.Object convert(@Nullable
                                                     @Nullable java.lang.Object source,
                                                     java.lang.reflect.Type sourceType,
                                                     java.lang.reflect.Type targetType,
                                                     GekConverter converter)
        Description copied from interface: GekConverter.Handler
        Converts object from source type to target type.

        In general, all handlers in the converter (GekConverter.getHandlers()) will be invoked this method sequentially. The result of this method in 4 types: null, GekFlag, GekWrapper and others.

        If this method returns null, means this handler can not do this conversion, and it will hand off to next handler; If this method returns an instance of GekFlag, means:

        • GekFlag.CONTINUE: same as null, means that this handler can not do this conversion, and it will hand off to next handler;
        • GekFlag.BREAK or GekFlag.RETURN: means that this handler can not do the conversion, and it will break out the handler chain. This will cause the conversion failure in this converter;
        • GekFlag.NULL or GekWrapper.empty(): means the result of this conversion is clearly null;
        • Other instance of GekFlag is a wrong result, will throw a GekConvertException.
        If this method returns a GekWrapper, wrapped object (from GekWrapper.get()) is actual result of conversion, including GekFlag, null and GekWrapper itself. Any other type of returned object is the actual result of conversion.
        Specified by:
        convert in interface GekConverter.Handler
        Parameters:
        source - source object
        sourceType - source type
        targetType - target type
        converter - converter to help convert unsupported part of object for this handler.
        Returns:
        converted object or null
